intro: Chiococca naiguatensis, commonly known as the Guiana chiococca, is a climbing shrub native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruits are capsules that release tiny seeds when mature. Chiococca naiguatensis plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat by providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
